comments.comment: Felix never try to blend any liquid that's boiling hot. It creates a huge pressure inside the container, that's why your blender started gushing out sauce at the end. Also I think egg yolks and butter combined should taste good. I think it smelled foul cause you added G-Fuel to it

I would like the banana recipe.

Let me explain, my father was a chef in the 70s, growing up he would always excitedly come home with some new recipe to try. Often they involved gelatin. One day on Christmas Eve he came home bursting with pride to have us try his new dish. It was bananas and ham in hollandaise. I could not believe it. A recipe without gelatin? But he insisted it was delicious. My sister and I cautiously tried and and couldn’t believe the flavor. It was warm! It didn’t jiggle! Salty and sweet at the same time, and most shocking was there was no mayo in it at all. It was the happiest Christmas eve dinner we ever had. Our father died shortly after and never wrote down his famous recipe. 

Please, pewds, for the nostalgia, send me the bananas ham hollandaise.
I would want this hambanana to feed it to the neighbour's kid and finally put his soul to peace. Thanks Pewds.

Yes, they DID discover gelatin and put it on everything.
This was big corp’s way of advertising these meals to sell more gelatin powder. Most people did not regularly eat these. I used to take care of an older lady who absolutely loved the mint jelly with steak, though

As someone who graduated from chef school i can say that hollandaise sauce is one of the most hardest thing to master for a beginner because even if you really can do one and you do it many times, something can still easily make it bad. The temperature, the intervals of putting the butter into the egg yolk mixture and etc.
i hope you make more cooking videos! its really relaxing to eat food with your cooking/food-themed videos

"It's like they just discovered gelatin"
They did, before the 70s gelatin was really rare and hard to make, until they invented some way to make a ton of it cheaply and suddenly everyone wanted to put it into everything.
"what kind of drugs were they on in the 70s?"
All of them, because it was the last time literally everything was still legal and about the time all of them were invented

The sweet smell of banana ham reminds me of my childhood on the farm. After a long day of playing with the pigs, I'd start picking up the scent of mustard with a hidden sweetness and I knew I was in for a treat. My mom would call me inside for dinner, and 90% of the time it was banana ham, or hamanas as my 8 year old self would call it.

I haven't had it in years, and I'd love to reminisce my childhood but I am unable to cook and I've never found it at a restaurant for some odd reason. If you'd send me your leftovers, I'd be in heaven!

I know this is an old video but its kinda funny that in my home, my mother made this recipe for me and I actually liked! She saw the recipe written in a heavy cream package and it's little bit different from what Pewds made. 
It's just heavy cream, bananas, ham, cheese slices, salt and nutmeg. You roll the bananas with chesse and then the ham and pour the heavy cream, add salt and the nutmeg to your liking and bake it. And there you have it!

I want this recipe because it cuts down the time it takes you to eat. Why bother eating a long and tedious meal, to then get a drink and then eat your dessert, when you can combine it into a 3-in-1 megameal? You got the drink (mustard), you got the meal (ham), and you also have the dessert (banana). It's great if you don't have time to waste on useless activities like eating. And the cherry on top, you also don't need to waste time on the toilet! You just feel like you need to go, and you go! Great recipe!

Hello Pewds. During the first semester of this university year, me and my friends formed a group and worked on a long and difficult project. The first part of this project was done while we were all constantly listening to a French song called "ça sent la banane" (translation : it smells like banana). This song helped us a lot to work through this difficult task, and now, part two of the project is taking place. This is why we would like to be honored to receive this fantastic meal. We would like to share it together, boost the troops and work as hard as possible so we can complete this year-long project. Thank you for considering this demand. Much love from Belgium !
Tip for you pewds, when making a sauce, if it's too runny, add more of the base ingredient. In a hollandaise, add more yolk and butter. In things like gravy or bechamel, add flour.

If you're curious about the mustard, it's just an emulcifier for the eggs. It acts as a binder for all the liquid and turns it into a mayo texture IF you mix it together properly. Mustard is great for this.
